Package provided.discovery

Interface IEndPointData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<IEndPointData>, java.io.Serializable
    public interface IEndPointData
extends java.lang.Comparable<IEndPointData>, java.io.Serializable
    Represents the INFORMATION necessary to connect to the Registry of a particular machine and retrieve a stub with a given bound name. The machine's Registry port is assumed to be IRMI_Defs.REGISTRY_PORT. IEndPoints are "naturally ordered", i.e. they are Comparable and thus can be sorted without using an external Comparator. Note that even if this end point's isActive() returns true, the RMI stub to whom this end point data refers may not be available if the stub's provider had crashed within the grace period allowed by the remote discovery server machine.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String getAddress()
      Get the IP address associated whose Registry has the RMI stub object associated with this end point.
      java.lang.String getBoundName()
      Get the Registry bound name of the RMI stub associated with this end point.
      java.lang.String getCategory()
      Get the category associated with this end point.
      java.lang.String getFriendlyName()
      Get the friendly name associated with this end point.
      boolean isActive()
      Checks if the end point is still active.

      • getAddress

        java.lang.String getAddress()
        Get the IP address associated whose Registry has the RMI stub object associated with this end point.
        Returns:

      • getBoundName

        java.lang.String getBoundName()
        Get the Registry bound name of the RMI stub associated with this end point.
        Returns:
        The bound name of the stub in the associated Registry

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Checks if the end point is still active. Call this method JUST BEFORE USING the end point. However, even then, then end point may still not be valid if end point location has crashed within the allowed grace period. So be sure to catch possible connection errors when using this end point data to retrieve a stub from a remote Registry.
        Returns:
        True if the end point is still registered on the remote discovery server machine.
